summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/04 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sam Esmail', 'Jim McKay', 'Tricia Brock', 'Deborah Chow', 'Nisha Ganatra', 'Niels Arden Oplev', 'Christoph Schrewe'], 'Producers': ['Sam Esmail', 'Kyle Bradstreet', 'Steve Golin', 'Chad Hamilton'], 'Starring': ['Rami Malek', 'Christian Slater']} Review Text: Pretty clever plot lines (though not always realistic) and very good acting. Far more interesting than you think a "hacker" drama would be. Definitely R-rated and pushes the limit of that at times. I'll keep watching on Amazon Prime. Review Title: Better than expected for a hacker drama Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/09/22 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Rob Rapley'], 'Producers': ['Rob Rapley', 'Stephanie Haberman Bordas', 'Kathryn Lord'], 'Starring': ['Michael Murphy', 'Shuler Hensley', 'Kathryn Erbe'], 'Studio': ['PBS']} Review Text: Lots of info about presidents Garfield and Arthur I never knew. Garfield could have been one of the best presidents ever. Looks like his doctor did more to kill him than the guy who shot him. Good acting in the docu-drama parts. Very engrossing. Review Title: Well worth your time if you like learning little known history. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/11/02 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Starring': ['Paul Giamatti', 'Laura Linney', 'Stephen Dilane'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Review Text: Johnny A finally gets his due! And Abigail too!
Fantastic acting. Great production quality for a period piece.
Adams, Jefferson, Washington, Hamilton, and Franklin are all here. Review Title: Entertaining and educational! All the founding fathers excellently portrayed--but Abigail steals the show! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/01/05 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Bill Condon'], 'Producers': ['Anne Carey', 'Iain Canning', 'Emile Sherman', 'Len Blavatnik', 'Aviv Giladi', 'Vince Holden', 'Christine Langan', 'Zanne Devine', 'Amy Nauiokas'], 'Starring': ['Ian McKellen', 'Laura Linney', 'Hiroyuki Sanada'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} Review Text: Great acting but devoid of any action or intrigue. This is a drama about a retired Sherlock slipping into senility. Mystery fans will be disappointed. Review Title: Boring but well-acted drama. Not a Sherlock mystery movie. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Heist Review Date: 2017/01/25 Categories: Suspense, Action, Cerebral, Intense Product Description: ["A casino card dealer, desperate to pay for his daughter's life-saving surgery, teams up with a co-worker to pull off a casino heist, but as the plan falters they find themselves hijacking a bus and using the hostages as collateral."] Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Scott Mann'], 'Producers': ['Randall Emmett', 'George Furla', 'Wayne Marc Godfrey', 'Robert Jones', 'Stephen Sepher', 'Alexander Tabrizi'], 'Starring': ['Dave Bautista', 'Jeffrey Dean Morgan', 'Robert De Niro']} Review Text: Major plot flaws in an otherwise clever heist film. Despite that, it was worth watching (for free with Prime membership). Review Title: This is not a DeNiro caliber film--but somewhat enjoyable. Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/01/25 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'frightening scenes', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Sam Raimi'], 'Producers': ['Tom Rosenberg', 'James Jacks', 'Gary Lucchesi', 'Robert G. Tapert', 'Rob Tapert'], 'Starring': ['Keanu Reeves', 'Cate Blanchett', 'Hilary Swank']} Review Text: Superstar line-up delivers good acting in this redneck-ESP thriller. Keanu makes a good bad guy. Review Title: Good ESP-crime-mystery drama Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/02/11 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Susanne Bier'], 'Producers': ['Susanne Bier', 'Khadija Alami', 'Alexei Boltho', 'Rob Bullock', 'Simon Cornwell', 'Stephen Cornwell', 'Sam Englebardt', 'José Luis Escolar', 'David Farr', 'Brian Flanagan'], 'Starring': ['Hugh Laurie', 'Tom Hiddleston', 'Nader Boussandel']} Review Text: Hugh Laurie is great. Review Title: A good 6-episode drama. Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/01/17 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jason Reitman'], 'Producers': ['David O. Sacks'], 'Starring': ['Aaron Eckhart', 'Robert Duvall', 'Katie Holmes'], 'Studio': ['20TH CENTURY FOX']} Review Text: Entertaining, funny, and great sociopolitical commentary. Review Title: Great, great movie for adults and teens Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Booksmart Review Date: 2020/02/14 Categories: Comedy, Confused, Joyous, Coarse Product Description: ['In this refreshingly unfiltered comedy, two overachieving best friends decide to cram four years of fun into one daring, chaotic adventure on the eve of their high school graduation.'] Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Olivia Wilde'], 'Producers': ['Megan Ellison'], 'Starring': ['Kaitlyn Dever : Amy', 'Beanie Feldstein : Molly', 'Jessica R. Williams : Ms. Fine']} Review Text: Funny, funny, funny!!!
Not for prudes! Review Title: Funny funny girls!!! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/12/26 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Michael Walker'], 'Producers': ['Alfred Sapse', 'John Wollman'], 'Starring': ['Joshua Caras', 'Olivia Luccardi', 'Paul Cooper'], 'Studio': ['Gravitas Ventures']} Review Text: Great film about artists and the art world. Great writing. Thoroughly entertaining. Funny. So much better than most big studio movies. Review Title: Fun movie about about artists and the art world. Great Indy film. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/01/12 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Linklater', 'Richard'], 'Producers': ['Linklater', 'Richard', 'Cinetic'], 'Starring': ['Taylor', 'Teresa', 'Mackey', 'Louis', 'Slate', 'John'], 'Studio': ['Detour Filmproduction']} Review Text: Great low budget movie about nothing; just following one schmo to the next. Review Title: Austin, TX in 1990. Kooky fun. Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user consistently appreciates clever and engaging narratives across various genres. They express admiration for the quality of acting and production in their viewing choices, particularly in historical and dramatic portrayals, highlighting performances that stand out, such as a captivating delivery in period pieces. The user also finds substantial value in educational content, enjoying insightful documentaries that offer new perspectives on historical figures. Humorous elements and enjoyable storytelling, especially in comedies, receive high marks, indicating a preference for entertaining yet thought-provoking material. Overall, there's a strong inclination toward content that blends humor or historical depth with engaging performance.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
The user has identified a few disappointments primarily related to pacing and narrative execution. They express frustration with underwhelming story arcs, especially in expectations set by specific genres like mystery or heist films. Instances of major plot flaws detract from the overall enjoyment, leading them to label certain films as not worth their time. There are also comments about specific films lacking the action or intrigue expected based on their descriptions. Additionally, the user notes experiences that feel convoluted or boring, which can overshadow the strengths present in some productions.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user's purchase history reveals a balanced mix of positive and negative experiences. They appreciate high-quality performances and engaging plots in various genres, particularly historical dramas and comedies that provide entertainment value. However, disappointment arises with films that fail to meet genre expectations or exhibit significant plot flaws. Despite some negative instances, the user continues to seek out content that satisfies their criteria for cleverness and engaging storytelling, maintaining an overall optimistic approach to their viewing choices. Overall, the pattern reflects a discerning taste that values both substance and enjoyment in media consumption.

target_interaction.title: Um... yeah... interesting Indy film.
target_interaction.text: Kooky and offbeat. Fun. Weird. Like most Indy films, not for those who only like traditional Hollywood narratives.  Debra Winger is in it.
